sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: This is Euronews Now. I'm Helena Humphrey. Here are your top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's President Zelenskyy vows to protect UN inspectors trying to reach the Zaporizhia nuclear power plant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The EU energy crisis deepens as Russia shuts off the Nord Stream 1 gas pipeline, citing maintenance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: the Nord Stream 1 gas pipeline, citing maintenance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And tributes pour in for Mikhail Gorbachev, the last leader of the Soviet Union, who's died at the age of 91.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: After months of shelling at the Zorozhye plant in southern Ukraine, sparking fears of a nuclear disaster, these international experts hope to ease the situation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In his nightly address, President Volodymyr Zelensky has accused Russia of targeting the inspector's route.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It is an important mission, and we will do everything to ensure that it takes place safely.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Unfortunately, Russia does not stop its provocations precisely in the directions by which the mission must arrive at the plant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The team is expected to arrive at the Russian-occupied power plant on Wednesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They will assess the situation on the ground as well as any potential damage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Both sides are blaming each other for recent shelling.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Over the past 24 hours, Ukrainian artillery fired two shells into the territory of the nuclear power plant. The radiation situation at Zaporozhye nuclear power plant remains normal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This as Ukraine's counter-offensive enters day three in the country's occupied south. Its military claims to have destroyed bridges, ammunition depots and to have pounded command posts. But Russia says it has inflicted heavy casualties in return. Kyiv's counterattack comes after several weeks of relative deadlock in a war that has killed thousands, displaced millions and destroyed cities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The European Union is stepping up initiatives to limit its dependence on Russian gas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Seven Baltic Sea nations have announced their commitment to a seven-fold increase in wind power production to 20 gigawatts by 2030.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Enough to supply electricity to 20 million households.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Putin's attempt to blackmail us with fossil fuels is failing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We are accelerating the green transition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We are getting rid of the dependency of Russian fossil fuels and we are accelerating the renewable, clean, cheaper and homegrown renewable energy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Brussels is also working to reform the electricity market to stop the cost of natural gas, determining electricity prices.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Other European nations are also pushing for new energy solutions, including Spain, where Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez wants to create a gas pipeline linking the Iberian Peninsula to Central Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: An idea which has been received positively by Germany.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: I want to again underline that I very much support creating such a connection.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: It's about improving the interconnections of the European gas network today and in the long term. It's also about using hydrogen together." Brussels is calling on member states to cut energy usage by 15 percent, as over the last several months Russia's state energy giant Gazprom has cut off or reduced its supplies to a dozen EU countries. Most recently France, where an energy sobriety plan is being set up.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: We must consume less energy at home, in transport, in shops, in businesses.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: It is a collective commitment to reduce energy consumption that must be made.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Energy prices across Europe have soared due to the war in Ukraine, with gas costing almost 12 times more now than the start of 2021.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Discussions are ongoing within the EU to find a European approach to energy pricing mechanisms. The Soviet Union's last leader, Mikhail Govichov, has died at age 91.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: He is known for the extraordinary reforms that led to the end of the Cold War.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In 1990, he won a Nobel Peace Prize for that role and spent his later years collecting accolades and awards from all corners of the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Yet he was widely despised at home. Russians blamed him for the 1991 implosion of the Soviet Union. The hospital in Moscow where he died said he had been suffering from a long and serious illness. To the West, a statesman and a star. To Russia, a figure of controversy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: A man who came from the Russian steppes and who would change the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: His friends and companions described him as ambitious, hardworking, charismatic and kind.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: As he moved up the ranks in the Communist Party, he grew more and more frustrated with a system that made improvement impossible. Once head of the Soviet Union, he launched the perestroika, which means restructuring, and glasnost, transparency. But in 1986, following the nuclear disaster in Chernobyl, there was no sign of transparency. Information was withheld and then misrepresented.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Gorbachev only addressed the people 19 days after the accident, saying authorities had been afraid of panic and admitting his mistake.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: After that, Gorbachev was more determined than ever to implement his reforms.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In 1987, he signed with US President Ronald Reagan a treaty banning intermediate-range nuclear missiles.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Gorbachev and Reagan both wanted change, and their friendship ultimately helped thaw the Cold War.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Gorbachev had unleashed forces that he chose not to check.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: When, after months of protests, the Berlin Wall came down in 1989, he didn't intervene and in doing so avoided a bloodbath.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But his permissiveness didn't extend to the Baltic states.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In January 1991, Lithuania's bid for independence was suppressed by Soviet troops.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In the clashes, 13 civilians died.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In August of that year, hard-line members in the Communist Party opposed to Gorbachev's reforms attempted a military coup. They were defeated in Moscow by civilian resistance led by Boris Yeltsin. Gorbachev, who had been held at his home in Crimea, lost his authority. He resigned in December 1991 and a few days later the Soviet Union officially ceased to exist.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Gorbachev would be awarded the Nobel Peace Prize and will be remembered as the man whose reforms hastened the end of the Soviet Union and brought the Cold War to a peaceful end.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: His own assessment of his career?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Some people see me as a soft man, he said.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But isn't it interesting that such a soft man changed so much in the space of six years?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: I made the right choices.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: If I were to return in time, I would make the same choices, but I wouldn't make the same mistakes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Since the death of Mikhail Gorbachev on Tuesday, tributes from across the world have come flooding

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: in for the last leader of the Soviet Union who changed global politics.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: On Twitter, President of the EU Commission Ursula von der Leyen called him a trusted and respected leader.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: UN chief Antonio Guterres added that he changed the course of history.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson praised his courage and integrity in bringing the Cold War to a peaceful conclusion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And France's Emmanuel Macron held Gorbachev as a man of peace.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: When the world saw conflict and stalemate, he saw peace and possibility.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: He was the epitome of courage and vision, and he was a reminder that it takes more courage to end a war than to start one.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The Australian treasurer, Jim Chalmers, summed up what many are surely thinking, comparing Gorbachev's legacy to the situation Russia currently finds itself in.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: You're watching Euronews now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Stay with us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We're back after a very short break.
